title: How to Make a Soda Bottle Cloche

steps.headline: Take a soda bottle of any size.
steps.description: Size depends on the size of the plant/seedling/seed you are making the cloche for.

steps.headline: Make a mark on the bottle using a pen or permanent marker.
steps.description: This mark should be no farther up the bottle than one or two inches (2.54 to 5.08 cm).

steps.headline: Using a razor, cut off the bottom of the bottle where you have made the mark.
steps.description: Kids, be sure to ask an adult to help you with this part.

steps.headline: Unscrew the cap and sink the cut edge of the bottle into the soil (proper depth depends on the size of the plant/seedling/seed as well as that of the cloche).
steps.description: Unscrewing the cap promotes good ventilation, while still preserving proper humidity levels.

text: Take a soda bottle of any size. Size depends on the size of the plant/seedling/seed you are making the cloche for. Make a mark on the bottle using a pen or permanent marker. This mark should be no farther up the bottle than one or two inches (2.54 to 5.08 cm). Using a razor, cut off the bottom of the bottle where you have made the mark. Kids, be sure to ask an adult to help you with this part. Unscrew the cap and sink the cut edge of the bottle into the soil (proper depth depends on the size of the plant/seedling/seed as well as that of the cloche). Unscrewing the cap promotes good ventilation, while still preserving proper humidity levels. Finished.
